intro: Cotula minor, commonly known as lesser cotula, is a small, annual herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or disturbed areas. Cotula minor is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
